intro: Eremitis afimbriata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed eremitis, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, while the flowers are small and yellow, forming dense clusters. Eremitis afimbriata is often used in succulent gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
